item.description:
Blues 'Professor' Opens Sharon's Lakeside Concert Series
The Wednesday night series starts July 11.

Professor Louie & The Crowmatix open the Wednesday night series at the Veteran's Memorial Park bandstand on July 11, says resident Lee Shapiro, who organized the series for the Sharon Recreation Department.

All shows will start at 7 p.m. Wednesday. Rain will move a show to the Sharon Community Center.

Professor Louie & The Cromatix became the first inductees into the International Blues Hall of Fame's New York chapter earlier this year, according to the band's website.

The band is releasing its new CD, "Wings on Fire," this month, the site notes.

The rest of this Sharon concert schedule is as follows, Shapiro said:

July 18: Girl Howdy
July 25: Incendio
Aug. 1: Love Fest, featuring Becky Chase
Aug. 8: Occidental Gypsy
Aug. 15: Henri Smith's New Orleans Friends and Flavours

These are wonderful evenings under the stars with great entertainment. Bring a picnic dinner or buy food at the concession stand. Go for a swim or just sit and enjoy the music. Bring a chair; there is plenty of parking.
item.name: Concerts on the Lake begin on July 11th
